publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4311 Elaine Murray: World Oceans Day—That the Parliament notes that 8 June 2009 has been designated by the United Nations as World Oceans Day to encourage international appreciation and celebration of the world’s oceans and seas; further notes that this year’s theme is one ocean, one climate, one future; expresses grave concern about the effect of human behaviour on the health and biodiversity of the oceans, and encourages members to "wear blue and talk to two" to raise public awareness of the need to restore the health of the marine environment. Supported by: Sarah Boyack*, John Park*, James Kelly*, Claire Baker* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S3M-4311 Elaine Murray: World Oceans Day—That the Parliament notes that 8 June 2009 has been designated by the United Nations as World Oceans Day to encourage international appreciation and celebration of the world’s oceans and seas; further notes that this year’s theme is one ocean, one climate, one future; expresses grave concern about the effect of human behaviour on the health and biodiversity of the oceans, and encourages members to "wear blue and talk to two" to raise public awareness of the need to restore the health of the marine environment. Supported by: Sarah Boyack, John Park, James Kelly, Claire Baker
S3M-4311 World Oceans Day (lodged on 4 June 2009) Jackie Baillie*, Karen Gillon*, Mary Mulligan*, Kenneth Gibson*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Marlyn Glen*, Pauline McNeill*, Des McNulty*, Lewis Macdonald*
S3M-4311 World Oceans Day (lodged on 4 June 2009) Hugh O’Donnell*, Jamie Hepburn*, Cathie Craigie*, Jack McConnell*
S3M-4311 World Oceans Day (lodged on 4 June 2009) Karen Whitefield*
S3M-4311 World Oceans Day (lodged on 4 June 2009) Gil Paterson*, Rhoda Grant*, Peter Peacock*, Irene Oldfather*
S3M-4311 World Oceans Day (lodged on 4 June 2009) Tom McCabe*
S3M-4311 World Oceans Day (lodged on 4 June 2009) Marilyn Livingstone*, Stuart McMillan*
